title: Turkish airlines flight makes safe landing at BIA
byline: A Turkish Airlines passenger flight safely landed at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake last night after reporting a landing gear malfunction, airport officials confirmed.

title: BIA on standby as Turkish Airlines flight reports landing gear issue
byline: The runway at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake has been readied for an emergency landing after a Turkish Airlines passenger flight reported a landing gear malfunction, airport officials confirmed.

title: PSG ordered to pay Mbappe 60m euros
byline: Paris St-Germain have been ordered to pay former striker Kylian Mbappe 60m euros (£52.5m) in unpaid salary and bonuses by a French court.

title: Goods train successfully operates from China Bay to Seeduwa
byline: A goods train operated successfully from China Bay to Seeduwa today, despite disruptions to rail services on the Eastern Line caused by Cyclone Ditwah, the Railways Department said.

title: Sri Lanka Unveil T20I Squad for India Tour Ahead of Women’s World Cup 2026
byline: Sri Lanka have announced a 15-member squad for their upcoming five-match Women’s T20 International series against India, marking an important step in their preparations for the ICC Women’s T20 World Cup 2026 in England.

title: Japan extends $2.5 million emergency grant to Sri Lanka
byline: The Japanese government has decided to provide an emergency grant of $2.5 million to Sri Lanka following the devastation caused by a cyclone that struck the country in late November, Japanese Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said on Tuesday.

title: Pathum Nissanka picked by Delhi Capitals for INR 4 Crore
byline: Sri Lanka opener Pathum Nissanka has been signed by the Delhi Capitals for INR 4 crore at the IPL 2026 player auction held in Abu Dhabi.

title: Pramodya Wickramasinghe appointed chairman of National Cricket Selection Committee
byline: Pramodya Wickramasinghe has been appointed as the Chairman of the National Cricket Selection Committee.

title: NPP-led Balapitiya Pradeshiya Sabha budget defeated by one vote
byline: The inaugural budget of the Balapitiya Pradeshiya Sabha, controlled by the National People’s Power (NPP), was defeated at a council meeting held today.

title: Red landslide warnings lifted; amber alerts extended
byline: Previously issued Level 3 (Red) landslide warnings have been lifted, while Level 2 (Amber) and Level 1 (Yellow) warnings have been extended in several districts after authorities reviewed current ground conditions and recent rainfall.

title: Trump under fire for ‘loathsome’ post about death of Rob Reiner and wife
byline: President Donald Trump is under fire over his comments on the deaths of legendary Hollywood director and actor Rob Reiner, 78, and his wife Michele Singer Reiner, 68, who were found fatally stabbed at their Los Angeles home Sunday.

title: Rains return as country battles to recover from Ditwah
byline: Showery weather has returned to several parts of the country, with the Meteorology Department warning that rain will continue over the Northern and Eastern regions during the next few days under the influence of an Easterly wave.

title: KKR Splash ₹18 Crore on Matheesha Pathirana at IPL 2026 Auction
byline: Sri Lankan pace sensation Matheesha Pathirana landed a blockbuster deal at the IPL 2026 auction, with Kolkata Knight Riders snapping him up for a massive ₹18 crore.

title: Wanindu Hasaranga Joins LSG for IPL 2026 at ₹2 Crore
byline: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) have snapped up Sri Lankan spin star Wanindu Hasaranga at the IPL 2026 Mini Auction, securing the all-rounder for ₹2.00 crore.

title: Police release suspect photo in Mahawa shop burglaries
byline: Mahawa Police have released a photograph of a suspect wanted in connection with recent shop burglaries in the area.

title: Create Ministry for disaster management: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today urged President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to create a Ministry for disaster management to be in charge of preventing and managing disasters.

title: Probe launched into police action involving Ranwala’s accident: Nalinda
byline: Investigation has been launched into whether there had been any negligence of duties or delays in implementing the law on the part of the police when taking action against the road accident involving former Speaker MP Ashoka Ranwala, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Government pledges continued support for mothers and children
byline: Even amid challenging circumstances, the government remains committed to investing in mothers and children, Women and Child Affairs Minister Saroja Savithri Paulraj said today.

title: Cabinet approves expansion of medical supply storage
byline: The Cabinet has approved a proposal to expand the storage capacity of the Medical Supply Division, which operates under the Health and Mass Media Ministry.

title: Six Thai women arrested in Kollupitiya brothel
byline: Six Thai nationals were arrested after police raided a brothel allegedly operating under the guise of a spa in Kollupitiya.

title: Cabinet approves commemorative stamps for 50 years of Sri Lanka–Saudi ties
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to issue two commemorative stamps celebrating the 50th anniversary of diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and Saudi Arabia.

title: Cabinet approves release of Yala paddy stocks to market
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved steps to mill and release paddy stocks purchased during the last Yala season by the Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) using funds allocated for 2025.

title: Cabinet approves key appointments in state departments
byline: The Cabinet Ministers has approved appointments to two senior positions in Sri Lanka’s state administrative services, following recent vacancies.

title: Judicial digitalisation project gets Cabinet nod
byline: The Government has identified the digitalisation of Sri Lanka’s judicial system as a national priority, with the aim of improving efficiency, transparency and access to justice.

title: NPP will take disciplinary action against Ranwala if he has cheated on doctorate: Nalinda
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) will take disciplinary action against former Speaker Ashoka Ranwala if he has cheated on his doctorate, Health Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Passenger arrested at BIA with Rs. 285,000 cigarettes
byline: A Sri Lankan passenger attempting to smuggle a consignment of foreign-made cigarettes valued at Rs. 285,000 through the Green Channel at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) was arrested by airport Customs officers this morning.

title: Trump files $5bn defamation lawsuit against BBC over Panorama speech edit
byline: US President Donald Trump has filed a $5bn (£3.7bn) lawsuit against the BBC over an edit of his 6 January 2021 speech in a Panorama documentary.

title: Sri Lanka Ambassador meets Bahrain crown prince
byline: The Ambassador of Sri Lanka to the Kingdom of Bahrain, Shanika Dissanayake, met His Royal Highness Prince Salman bin Hamad Al Khalifa, Crown Prince and Prime Minister of Bahrain, at the Gudaibiya Palace in Manama on Sunday (14).

title: Indian aid ship arrives in Colombo after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Another ship carrying Indian humanitarian assistance under Operation Sagar Bandhu has arrived at the Colombo Port to support Sri Lanka’s relief efforts following Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Security beefed up for Ashes Adelaide Test after Bondi shooting
byline: Police armed with rifles will be part of a beefed up security presence at the third Test between Australia and England at Adelaide Oval after the Bondi Beach shooting attacks, officials said, while flags will be flown at half-mast.
